value.0: <StartAction>[Gilles comes running towards you quickly.]</Start> It is so good to see you alive, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>! Your father has been worried sick since he heard of the attempt on your life!

<StartAction>[Gilles appears quite uncomfortable at your words.]</Start> Please, the Magistrate wishes for you to come see him immediately, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>. I believe he is quite concerned over your safety...
I am merely the messenger, m'<lord/lady>. Please, your father asks that you come to him with all haste...
<StartAction>[Gilles bows before you, and hurries off once more.]</Start>
Then all the more reason for you to go to the Magistrate at once. He wishes to see you immediately, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>. Please, go to the Magistrate with all haste...
He's finishing up some meetings in the Grand Hall and has asked that you meet him there.
<StartAction>[Gilles comes rushing towards you as you enter the Imperial District, his elderly face red and his breathing heavy from the exertion.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Huff, huff.]</Start> I'm glad I was able to catch you, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>. I bring news from your father...
<StartAction>[The elderly fellow seems quite stricken with fear at your words, and begins to stammer incoherently.]</Start> I... I did not... did not mean to... to offend you... m'<lord/lady>...
<StartAction>[The old man seems to gather his calm, slowly regaining his words.]</Start>

Magistrate Okaris has found himself in counsel with visitors from Emperor Rakha, and apparently a matter of great urgency has arisen. He wishes to send his deepest apologies for missing your graduation ceremony this <quarterday>.
Magistrate Okaris says to assure you that he shall make it up to you later this day, and suggests that you perhaps spend a bit of time in the Market District until he sends for you.

I do apologize if I am the bearer of ill news, m'<lord/lady>. I bid you a good <quarterday>, and pray that Rakha keep you in his blessings. <StartAction>[The elderly gentleman scampers away quickly.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Gilles, the elderly servant of your father's household, rushes forward and bows before you. You notice that your father is suspiciously missing from his side...]</Start>
M'<lord/lady>, I see you have arrived for the graduation ceremony here at the Academy. I know your father must be proud to have a <CUSTOM6001> such as you today!

<StartAction>[The elderly gentleman cowers a bit at your wrath, stuttering incoherently.]</Start> Why... yes... er... of course, <sir/madam>... I... I shall go... Yes... yes... to find your father... see what is taking him so long...
That's a terrible thing to say, <FirstName>! Where are your manners, <lad/lass>? Your father merely wishes to see you succeed here in Ghaarak...
Now, now, <FirstName>. Your father is a busy man, being the Magistrate of Ghaarak and all. Perhaps he has merely been delayed for a short period of time.
I just could not imagine your father would fail to be here to witness such a grand event. In fact, I would wager he is on his way here even as we speak...
Magistrate Okaris will be here, <FirstName>. I am certain he would not miss the graduation of his only <CUSTOM6001> from the Imperial Academy...
Magistrate Okaris has a great deal on his mind, child. Do not mistake that for disinterest in your affairs. It cannot be easy ruling a city as troubled as Ghaarak, so do give him time...
In fact, I believe I shall go find your father right now, and see what is taking him so long. The ceremony will begin soon, and I'm sure he's merely tied up with some menial business.
Why don't you go speak with Instructor Jarvis, and begin the graduation ceremony? I shall return momentarily with Magistrate Okaris, surely in time to see you accept your honors...
Yes, yes... of course, <sir/madam>... I... I did not mean to... to offend you... Let me be on my way...
Now don't be that way, <FirstName>! I'm sure he will come running as soon as he realizes he is late...
<StartAction>[Gilles gives you a wink and a smile.]</Start> I'll have Magistrate Okaris here before you know it, <FirstName>...
<StartAction>[Without a further word, Gilles bows in farewell, and departs quickly from the Academy's walls.]</Start>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PRELUDE" >>
I can tend to myself, worm!
So worried he won't come find me himself!?
I'm surprised he even noticed...
So I'm to bow and scrape at his command, now?
I'll go see him in the Grand Hall, then.
It appears we're both in grave danger...
Yes, where can I find him?
Out with it, then, you worm!
I said out with it!
Settle down, Gilles. What did he say?
And what would that be?
Good! I didn't want him there anyway...
He's missed everything else. Why change now?
I wish he had been there but I understand, Gilles...
Away from me, worm! I have no time for you!
Everyone's waiting for me, Gilles. I'd better go.
I'd rather not suffer his constant prattling today...
So happy he can't be bothered to attend?!
I hope so, though I'm concerned by his absence...
I'm sure my "busy" father is hurrying on my behalf...
I won't be holding my breath...
I don't know... He's seemed distant of late.
Get out of here, worm, and let me get on with my day!
If he won't come for me, he won't come for you either...
Very well but please ensure my father comes soon...
